text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron rarilepidotum is a rhododendron species native to Sumatra, where it grows at altitudes of 1000–2500 m. It is a shrub that grows to 4 m in height, with elliptic leaves that are 9 × 3.5 cm in size. Flowers are orange or yellow, and broadly funnel-shaped.
text.References:
Contr. Arnold Arbor. 8: 126 1934.
Argent, G. (2006) Rhododendrons of subgenus Vireya. RHS:London. Page:243
